incidents.name: Widespread Internet Disruptions impacting New Relic Services

incident_updates.body: Between 17:54 UTC and 20:22 UTC, some customers in the US and EU region may have experienced various irregularities for data availability and alert notifications. Impacted services have returned to normal operations, following the recovery of our dependent cloud provider systems.
We are continuing to investigate this interruption with our cloud providers. We are seeing recovery of some impacted services and are taking action to mitigate impact where possible.

Starting at 17:53 UTC, some customers in the US and EU regions may experience timeouts, irregularities, and delays in their chart data related to a global outage happening across industry cloud providers.

We suppressed alerts from 20:36 to 20:48 May 25 UTC. We have resolved this interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

incidents.name: UI Irregularities and Alert Degradation in US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 12:52 UTC and 15:28 UTC on April 16th, 2025, some customers in the US may have experienced delayed data in queries, charts, and dashboards as well as delayed, missing, or false positive alert notifications for related data. We have resolved this interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

Starting approx 13:00 UTC on the 16th of April 2025, a subset of customers may have experienced missed alerts, delayed data impacting dashboards, UIs and API queries. We have reduced the latency at this point and are monitoring recovery.

Starting approx 13:00 UTC on the 16th of April 2025, a subset of customers may have experienced missed alerts, delayed data impacting dashboards, UIs and API queries. We have reduced the latency at this point and are monitoring recovery.

Some customers in the US region may be experiencing delayed data in queries, charts, and dashboards as well as delayed or missing alert notifications for related data. We are seeing recovery of some impacted services and are continuing to monitor.

Starting at around 13:00 UTC on the 16/04/2025, a subset of customers may be experiencing missed alerts and delayed data affecting dashboards, UI's and API queries. The primary issue triggering the incident has been identified and is in the process of being remediated.
We have identified the issue and are working on a fix for the issue.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Infrastructure Alerts- False Host Not Reporting

incident_updates.body: The restoration of affected entity metadata has now been completed. Impacted services have returned to normal operations.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : US - Infrastructure Agent : US

incident_updates.body:
We are seeing continued restoration of affected entity metadata through both standard agent refresh behaviors, as well as backup and recovery actions taken by our teams. Some customers in the US region may experience irregularities in charts, dashboards, and alert notifications for affected entities until full recovery has completed. 

We will provide our next update at 14:00 UTC on March 20th or upon significant change.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : US - Infrastructure Agent : US

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : US - Infrastructure Agent : US

We will provide our next update at 14:00 UTC on March 19th or upon significant change.

Our teams are investigating several paths to complete that process and will continue to provide updates as they are available.

incidents.name: Infrastructure Entity Irregularities - US and EU Region

incident_updates.body:
We identified and resolved an issue with entity metadata which affected the visibility of some infrastructure entities in the New Relic UI. Data ingest and alert notifications were not impacted.

After resolving the issue, we initiated a re-indexing process which has completed for the US and EU region restoring visibility of affected entities.

As the re-indexing process for the US region nears completion and we continue to see recovery of affected entities, we will provide our next update at 22:00 UTC today, September 12th or upon significant change. 

Some customers in the US region may experience issues viewing entities related to infrastructure cloud integrations, on-host integrations, and Kubernetes. Data ingest and alert notifications remain unaffected.

The re-indexing process for the US region is nearly complete and we are seeing recovery of most affected entities.

Some customers in the US region may experience issues viewing entities related to infrastructure cloud integrations, on-host integrations, and Kubernetes. Data ingest and alert notifications remain unaffected.

The re-indexing process for the US region is still in progress, which will take time to complete. Our teams are investigating opportunities to expedite the process, we will provide our next update at 13:00 UTC on September 12th or upon significant change.

Some customers in the US region may experience issues viewing entities related to infrastructure cloud integrations, on-host integrations, and Kubernetes. Visibility of affected entities in the EU region has been restored. Data ingest and alert notifications remain unaffected.

The re-indexing process has completed for the EU region and visibility of affected entities has been restored. The re-indexing process for the US region is still in progress, which may take time.

Some customers in the US region may experience issues viewing entities related to infrastructure cloud integrations, on-host integrations, and Kubernetes. Data ingest and alert notifications remain unaffected.

Some customers in the US and EU region may experience issues viewing entities related to infrastructure cloud integrations, on-host integrations, and Kubernetes. Data ingest and alert notifications are not impacted.

We have initiated a re-indexing process, which may take time and should restore visibility of affected entities as our teams continue their investigation.
We are investigating an issue that may impact infrastructure entities for customers in the US and EU region.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Browser Data and Alert Irregularities in the US Region

Between 18:04 UTC and 18:20 UTC and again from 19:04 UTC to 19:36 UTC on October 18th, some customers in the US regions may have experienced delayed browser data in queries, charts, and dashboards as well as delayed or missing alert notifications for related data. We have investigated and resolved this interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Data Ingest and Alert Delays in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 02:03 UTC and 05:45 UTC on Wednesday, September 6, 2023, some customers in the US region may have experienced an impact to data collection and delayed or missing alert notifications. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false-positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers between 02:20 UTC and 04:52 UTC.

We have investigated and resolved a service interruption with our Cloud Service Provider and impacted services have returned to normal operations.
